keyTakeAways: Lance Bass has type 1.5 diabetes, specifically latent autoimmune diabetes of adulthood (LADA).
He uses the Dexcom G7 Continuous Glucose Monitoring System to manage his condition effectively.
Bass created the online persona 'Blood Sugar Lance' to humorously educate the public about diabetes, which developed accidentally through social media content.
He identifies white rice and white bread as foods that significantly spike his blood sugar, even with insulin.
His uncle had type 1 diabetes, which influenced his early awareness of the condition.
Modern diabetes technology and community support have made managing diabetes easier and more manageable for him.
Stress from his career and parenting his four-year-old twins affects his blood sugar levels.
He currently does not have any plans for an *NSYNC reunion tour and dismisses recent articles suggesting otherwise as inaccurate.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Lance Bass, former member of the boy band *NSYNC, addresses fan concerns about a potential reunion with the group, stating there is no current plan for a tour. Instead, he emphasizes his openness about living with type 1.5 diabetes (LADA), sharing personal experiences and insights through his online persona 'Blood Sugar Lance' on Instagram. He highlights how continuous glucose monitoring with the Dexcom G7 system has transformed his daily management of blood sugar, particularly identifying white rice and white bread as harmful food triggers. His experience is rooted in family history, with his uncle having type 1 diabetes, and is enriched by modern technology and support from the diabetic community. Stress from his high-profile career and parenting his twins also plays a role in blood sugar fluctuations. title: Lance Bass Has More to Say About Living with Diabetes Than He Does About an *NSYNC Reunion
